channel.title: Error importing the gateway image using virsh
channel.description:
Hello, I am moving from VirtualBox to KVM. I followed the instructions on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/KVM for Debian Buster. I did not use sudo, but executed all commands that require root permissions as root.
When I arrived at importing the gateway image I get the following error:
root@BUSTER:/home/rnd/Downloads/wnx# virsh -c qemu:///system define ./Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-15.0.1.7.2.qcow2 error: Failed to read file './Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-15.0.1.7.2.qcow2': Value too large for defined data type
After running into this error, I noticed that I had missed to execute: virsh -c qemu:///system define ./Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-15.0.1.7.2.xml
This completed with success, but the error when importing the gateway remains.
Any help would be greatly appreciated.
Best regards,
R.

item.title: Error importing the gateway image using virsh
item.dc:creator: rnd442209
item.description:
Sorry… I have just realized that I messed something up. Please ignore my post.

Best,

R.

Read full topic

item.title: Error importing the gateway image using virsh
item.dc:creator: rnd442209
item.description:
Hello,
I am moving from VirtualBox to KVM. I followed the instructions on https://www.whonix.org/wiki/KVM for Debian Buster. I did not use sudo, but executed all commands that require root permissions as root.

When I arrived at importing the gateway image I get the following error:

root@BUSTER:/home/rnd/Downloads/wnx# virsh -c qemu:///system define ./Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-15.0.1.7.2.qcow2
error: Failed to read file ‘./Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-15.0.1.7.2.qcow2’: Value too large for defined data type

After running into this error, I noticed that I had missed to execute:
virsh -c qemu:///system define ./Whonix-Gateway-XFCE-15.0.1.7.2.xml

This completed with success, but the error when importing the gateway remains.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

Best regards,

R.
